IRenderWindow

Defines interface for interacting with a render window. A render window is a window that has a DirectX devince associated with it along with a scene graph.

Functions
GetSceneGraph

Returns the scene graph associated with this render window

GetRenderer
virtual CRefObj<IRenderer> GetRenderer() = 0

Returns the underlying renderer

MouseDown
virtual void MouseDown(
int x,
int y,
uint32 button,
uint32 flags
) = 0

Called when a mouse down event occurs in the window

Parameters
x
int

X position of mouse in pixels

y
int

Y position of mouse in pixels

button
uint32

integer indicating which button was pressed

flags
uint32

flags (control, shift, etc)

MouseMove
virtual void MouseMove(
int x,
int y,
uint32 flags
) = 0

Called when a mouse move event occurs in the window

Parameters
x
int

X position of mouse in pixels

y
int

Y position of mouse in pixels

flags
uint32

flags (control, shift, etc)

int x,
int y,
uint32 button,
uint32 flags
) = 0

int

int

MouseWheel
virtual void MouseWheel(
int factor
) = 0

Called when a mouse wheel event occurs in the window

Parameters
factor
int

number indicating which way the wheel was turned and how far

MapKey
virtual void MapKey(
uint32 wParam,
uint32 lParam
) = 0

Called when a key press event occurs in the window

Parameters
wParam
uint32

wParam from WM_KEY event

lParam
uint32

lParam from WM_KEY event

CreateRenderWindow
CAUSTICAPI CRefObj<IRenderWindow> CreateRenderWindow(
HWND hwnd,
std::wstring &shaderFolder
)

Creates an IRenderWindow

Parameters
hwnd
HWND

window to bind IRenderWindow to

shaderFolder
std::wstring&

Path to folder containing shaders

ppRenderWindow

returns the created render window
